title: Days of Remembrance of Victims of the Holocaust, 2025
summary:
The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump, dated April 23, 2025, declaring the Days of Remembrance of Victims of the Holocaust from April 20 to April 27, 2025. It commemorates the six million Jewish victims of the Holocaust, as well as other targeted groups, and emphasizes the importance of remembering their stories. The proclamation reflects on the 80th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz and recognizes the ongoing issues of anti-Semitism, particularly following the October 7, 2023, attack on Israel. 

The President expresses a commitment to combating anti-Semitism through legal measures and encourages the nation to observe these days with study, prayers, and commemoration to ensure that such atrocities are never repeated. The proclamation serves as a reminder of the need for vigilance against hate and a call to honor the memory of Holocaust victims.
